sub_title: Safety Case Coordinator at SBM Offshore
summary:
A proficient health, safety, and environmental leader with 12 years of technical design safety experience in providing risk management solutions to large customers in oil and gas, petrochemical, chemical and pharmaceutical industries.

A certified Functional Safety Engineer with expertise in hazard identification and risk assessment, safety case development, and safety reliability. Understanding of various HSE legislations, code of practices, guidelines, and ALARP principle for risk management supported by CBA. 

Passionate about mobilizing people to establish safer, sustainable, and environment friendly practices at various life-cycle stages of the industrial facilities – Conceptual Design, Front-End Engineering, Detail Design, Construction, Commissioning, and Operations.

Enjoys interrogating multifaceted issues to identify, design, and implement efficient and sustainable solutions to maximize the stakeholder values. Proven credentials in aligning strategy, processes, and assets including people to minimize the risk faced by the organizations. 

Entrepreneur with a strategic mind-set and proven track-record in building and managing HSE consultancy business, driving incremental revenues on international front. A natural leader, highly sought after during challenges that require innovation, entrepreneurship, strategic alignment, and transformation.

Diverse international experience, having lived in Europe, India, Asia Pacific, and the Middle East with direct management responsibilities for businesses in more than 10 countries including China. 

Core Skills: 
•	Workshop facilitation – PHA, HAZOP, SIL, SIMOPS, PHSER, Bowtie, and Constructability Review
•	Risk Assessment Studies – FERA, QRA, BRA, NHHA, EERA, and ESSA
•	COMAH, Safety Case, and HSEIA
•	Risk management strategies and frameworks
•	Entrepreneurship
•	People leadership: inspiring, motivating, and developing people and managing performance 
•	Recruitment and mentoring of fresh graduates

profile_positions.description: Responsible for implementing the Hazards and Effects Management Process (HEMP) and providing guidance on best practice risk management to engineering, supply chain, construction, and other departments.

profile_positions.description:
Fostering and maintaining regional relationships, as a principal advisor to the major clients. Core advisory sphere involves HSE risk management and business continuity for companies such as Qatar Petroleum, Abu Dhabi National Oil Company, and Masdar.

As a senior member of the HSE consultancy team, driving growth through developing new markets, innovating operations, and managing impactful delivery.

Transforming the portfolio of HSE services in coherence with the current and future energy markets. Renovating functional management structure and assisting in business strategy development during on-going acquisitions by Restrata.

Focused on the full HSE spectrum, Altor Risk Group (now Restrata) helps organizations reduce risk and increase safety performance. Working on both sides of the risk bowtie, it covers the Major Accident Hazard Management, Occupational HSE Management, and the building of Capacity & Competence.
profile_positions.title: Principal Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Accountable for building and scaling the HSE consultancy business across vertical, domains, and geographies with full P&L responsibility and organizational leadership. Complete responsibility of the product to market process including positioning within the Company portfolio matrix and process with other functions.

Led the multinational and multimarket business with a strong ability to lead and work within the multi-dimensional teams. Demonstrated refined management skills in the areas of leadership, strategy, operations, and collaboration. 

Acquired key accounts such as Pertamina, Petronas, and Premier Oil for the organization and built a highly profitable desk from scratch.

Built the Company brand by collaborating with the customers and employees, implementing ethical business practices. 

PT. EJJV Engineering Indonesia was incorporated in Indonesia as a private limited company on 19th July 2006. It’s a service provider to the Oil & Gas Industry, specializing in project management, work-pack development, HSE consultancy, and offshore construction, commissioning, integrated operations, and maintenance. EJ Joint Venture Sdn Bhd (in Malaysia) is the parent company of PT.EJJV Engineering Indonesia. EJJV Group offices are located in Malaysia, Indonesia, Korea, Singapore, and the United States.
profile_positions.title: Business Manager - HSE Consultancy Services

profile_positions.description:
Highly client-facing role as a trusted HSE advisor to the critical clients. Owned and managed the end-to-end relationships and delivery cycles including account planning, scoping discussion, proposal development, negotiations, project execution and delivery, and closure.
 
Represented clients during HSE risk presentations to various committees such as Pollution Control Board under Govt. of India. Under Ministry of Environment and Forest (India) developed Disaster Management Plans and Emergency Preparedness for various districts across India. 

Grew briskly from a technical to a leadership role in two years and led a team of 6 members. Built and led a performance driven and cross-country multilingual team, delivering large scale HSE engagements. Recruited, trained, and mentored fresh college graduates into exclusive risk and process safety management professionals.  

Instrumental to Director’s growth strategy of expansion in India, China, and Indonesia.

As the world’s leading one-stop source for industry’s process safety and optimization needs, Chilworth has international consulting bases and laboratory testing facilities with state of the art dust explosion and electrostatic laboratories (with low humidity facility), and a specialist laboratory for the evaluation of thermal runaway reactions.

The client base of Chilworth covers more than 20 countries, and includes manufacturing companies in the fine chemicals, pharmaceuticals, bulk organics, food stuffs, paints, resins/ plastics, dyestuffs, pigments, agrochemicals, soaps/ detergents, oil/ petrochemicals, and the legal and insurance fields.
